intro: Ecbolium anagalloides, commonly known as the stickyweed or woolly stork's bill, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves that are often covered in fine, sticky hairs. The plant produces small, pinkish to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its fruit is a slender, elongated capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. Ecbolium anagalloides is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
